sparqlresultformatdesc: Enable the client-side execution of sparql query to different endpoint and produce various output format.
sprf.special.parameter.name: Name
sprf.common.step1: Step 1. Define one or more sparql endpoint in LocalSettings.php
sprf.common.step1.explain:
If more than one endpoint is specified, ensure that the endpoint name is unique.
You can optionally specify credentials for http basic authentication.
You can optionally specify a list of prefixes. These are automatically added to sparql query (No need to redefine each time).
sprf.common.step2: Step 2. Export sparql result in different format using magic words described below
sprf.common.old.version: Old Version (for retro-compatibility) Do not use!
sprf.format.table.title: Html Table
sprf.format.table.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to an html table
sprf.format.table.query.structure: No constraint on sparql query. All fields in select list will be exported in csv.
sprf.format.csv.title: CSV
sprf.format.csv.description: Produce a link to download the result of a sparql query as csv file
sprf.format.csv.query.structure: No constraint on sparql query. All fields in select list will be columns in output table
sprf.format.graph.title: Node Graph
sprf.format.graph.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to a connected graph
sprf.format.graph.query.structure:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • The select list must contains exactly this variable names: ?parent_uri ?parent_name ?child_uri ?child_name ?parent_type ?parent_type_uri ?child_type ?child_type_uri ?relation_uri ?relation_name
sprf.format.graph.query.structure.old:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • The select list must contains exactly this values: ?parent_name ?child_name ?parent_type ?child_type ?relation_name
sprf.format.barchart.title: Bar Chart
sprf.format.barchart.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to a barchart
sprf.format.barchart.query.structure:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • The first column in select list represent each element in the x axis (for vertical chart) or y axis (for horizontal chart).
  • The following columns in select list must be composed by numerical values. Each of these columns represent a numerical series.
sprf.format.barchart.query.structure.exa:
select ?person count(?property) as ?num count(?property2)as ?num2
where { ?person rdf:type foaf:Person. ... }
sprf.format.piechart.title: Pie Chart
sprf.format.piechart.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to a piechart
sprf.format.piechart.query.structure:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • The first column in select list represent each slice of the pie.
  • The second column in select list must be composed by numerical values.
sprf.format.donutchart.title: Donut Chart
sprf.format.donutchart.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to a donutchart
sprf.format.donutchart.query.structure:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • The first column in select list represent each slice of the donut.
  • The following columns in select list must be composed by numerical values. Each of these columns represent a numerical series.
sprf.format.donutchart.query.structure.e:
select ?person count(?property) as ?num count(?property2)as ?num2
where { ?person rdf:type foaf:Person. ... }
sprf.format.bubblechart.title: Bubble Chart
sprf.format.bubblechart.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to a bubblechart
sprf.format.bubblechart.query.structure:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • The first column in select list represent each bubble on the chart.
  • The 2nd, 3rd e 4th column in select list must be composed by numerical values. They represent the x, y and r coordinate of the bubble.
select ?person count(?property) as ?x count(?property2) as ?y count(?property3) as ?r
where { ?person rdf:type foaf:Person. ... }
sprf.format.treemap.title: Treemap
sprf.format.treemap.description: Convert the result of a sparql query to a zoomable treemap
sprf.format.treemap.query.structure:
The query must adjust to the following rules:
  • All rows must represent a couple: parent value e child value with an optional numerical value
  • The first column is the parent. The second is the child. The third (optional) is the weight for leaves node.
  • If the third column is not specified the weight of all leaves will be set to 1
sprf.param.divId: Identifier of this element. Must be unique inside the page
sprf.param.sparqlEndpoint: Name of the endpoint to invoke defined in LocalSettings.php
sprf.param.spinnerImagePath: Url of image to show while the query is in execution.
sprf.param.divStyle: css definitions to put inline the container div
sprf.param.cssEvenRowClass: Css class of even <tr> elements of output table
sprf.param.cssOddRowClass: Css class of odd <tr> elements of output table
sprf.param.cssEvenTdClass: Css class of all <td> elements of all even rows of output table
sprf.param.cssOddTdClass: Css class of all <td> elements of all odd rows of output table
sprf.param.noResultMessage: Text message to be shown when the query returns no elements
sprf.param.cssOddTdClass: Css class of all <td> elements of all odd rows of output table
sprf.param.columnConfiguration:
JSON syntax for data presentation. You can specify an array of elements in which every element can define:
  • queryField - name of the column in the sparql query (without ?)
  • label - column header shown in table
  • showLink - true or false if you want every cell of this column have links (or not)
  • cellValuePattern - the pattern to apply to value. You must refer to cell value by using the placeholder {%s}
  • cellLinkPattern - the pattern to generate the link. You must refer to cell value by using the placeholder {%s}
sprf.param.filename: Name of the output csv file
sprf.param.separator: Separator char to be used in csv file
sprf.param.linkButtonCSSClass: if linkButtonLabel is defined you can specify the css class to the <button> element
sprf.param.linkButtonLabel: If defined, the magic word will produce a <button> element with this parameter as label
sprf.param.label: if linkButtonLabel is not defined, the magic word will produce a <a> element with this parameter as label
sprf.param.headerMapping: JSON object to map each column in the sparql query to another label
sprf.param.extraOption: You can specify as many extraOption parameter as you want. Each option must be specified in the following format: propName:propValue.The list of all supported options is listed in the table below.
sprf.param.divCssClass: Css class applied to container div
sprf.param.divCssClassFullScreen: Css class applied to container div in fullscreen mode
sprf.options.chart.title: Title of the chart
sprf.options.chart.series.color: List of colour to use in series
sprf.options.chart.serie.label: Label of the series
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.label.link.sh: true or false to specify if the label in tooltip is linkable
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.label.link.pa: Pattern to generate the url in label link
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.label.pattern: Pattern applied to label in tooltip
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.value.pattern: Pattern applied to the numeric value in tooltip
sprf.param.seriesConfiguration:
JSON array to configure every series. For each element you can specify:
  • label
  • color
  • assetPattern
  • assetLinkPattern
  • showLink
  • valuePattern
sprf.options.chart.bar.width: Width of the bar in pixels
sprf.options.chart.bar.margin: Number of pixels between groups of bars at adjacent axis values
sprf.options.chart.bar.padding: Number of pixels between adjacent bars at the same axis value
sprf.options.chart.axis.x.label: Name of x axis
sprf.options.chart.axis.y.label: Name of y axis
sprf.options.chart.axis.x.label.font.siz: Font size for x axis label
sprf.options.chart.axis.y.label.font.siz: Font size for y axis label
sprf.options.chart.axis.x.font.size: Font size for values in x axis
sprf.options.chart.axis.y.font.size: Font size for values in y axis
sprf.options.chart.axis.x.angle: Angle of text of x axis values, measured clockwise
sprf.options.chart.axis.y.angle: Angle of text of y axis values, measured clockwise
sprf.options.chart.legend.show: True or false to specify to show the legend
sprf.options.chart.legend.location: Location for legend. Possible values: nw, n, ne, e, se, s, sw, w
sprf.options.chart.legend.column.asset: The column name in legend for asset element (the single bubble element name)
sprf.options.chart.legend.column.radius: The column name in legend for the r coordinate
sprf.options.chart.height.automatic: <u>Only for horizontal barchart</u> it computes automatically the height of the container based on number of results
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.x.label: Name of x coordinate shown in tooltip
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.y.label: Name of y coordinate shown in tooltip
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.r.label: Name of r coordinate shown in tooltip
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.asset.label.p: Text pattern applied to show the asset element (the single bubble element) in tooltip. Refer to current name using the placeholder {%s}
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.asset.link.sh: true or false if the asset label must be also a link
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.asset.label.l: Text pattern to generate the link for asset label. Refer to current name using the placeholder {%s}
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.x.value.patte: Text pattern applied to show the value of x coordinate. Refer to current value using the placeholder {%d}
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.y.value.patte: Text pattern applied to show the value of y coordinate. Refer to current value using the placeholder {%d}
sprf.options.chart.tooltip.r.value.patte: Text pattern applied to show the value of r coordinate. Refer to current value using the placeholder {%d}
sprf.param.rootElement: The top element in the hierarchy. This could be styled in different way from other nodes. If the sparql query return object uris you must specify the uri ot the root element. Otherwise you must specify the label.
sprf.param.leavesLinkPattern: Pattern to generate url in leaves node. Refer to leaf value using {%s}
sprf.param.openLinkOnLeaves: true/false. If specified on leaves node it will open the url specified.
sprf.param.nodeConfiguration1: Configuration of nodes aspect based on their category (rdf:type). JSON syntax of array containing a definition for each node category.
sprf.param.nodeConfiguration2:
For each element you can specify:
  • category
  • nodeColor
  • image
  • dataTypeProps
  • objectProps
sprf.param.edgeConfiguration1: Configuration of edges aspect based on the relationship. JSON syntax of array containing a definition for each object property.
sprf.param.edgeConfiguration2:
For each element you can specify:
  • relation
  • edgeColor
sprf.param.rootElementImage: The image of rootElement node (this will override the rootElementColor property)
sprf.param.defaultNodeColor: Html default color for nodes (if not specified in nodeConfiguration param)
sprf.param.defaultEdgeColor: Html default color for edge (if not specified in edgeConfiguration param)
sprf.param.splitQueryByUnion: If the sparql param contains UNION parts and this parameter is set to 'true' it will split the query with n unions in n query with 1 query condition.
sprf.param.layout: Name of layout to use. Possible values: dagre, random, preset, grid, circle, concentric, breadthfirst, cose. [http://http://js.cytoscape.org/#layouts]
sprf.param.maxWordLength: Maximum word lenght in node label.
sprf.param.labelLinkPattern: Text pattern to generate the link of node label in tooltip. Refer to node label with placeholder {%s}
sprf.param.categoryLinkPattern: Text pattern to generate the link of node category in tooltip. Refer to node category with placeholder {%s}
sprf.param.csvExport: true/false. If true, generates a link to download the content of the table as csv file
sprf.param.csvFileName: The name of the output csv file
sprf.param.csvLinkLabel: Label of the link to download the csv
